snippet.title: Micro Machines - PlayStation 2 Gameplay
snippet.description:
Captured off of the PS2 using the Kaico HDMI converter.

This entry in the Micro Machines series was not developed by Codemasters, considering that Hasbro went to hand the license to Infogrames / Atari SA that time. Instead, it was developed by Infogrames Sheffield (AKA Gremlin Interactive, who made Zool, Monty on the Run and the Actua Sports series). In fact, it was one of their final games ever developed before they were closed down by Infogrames (AKA Atari SA or "modern" Atari).

While the PS2 (and PSP) did get a *true* sequel to Micro Machines V3 for the PSone in form of Micro Machines V4, Gamecube and GameBoy Advance fans were stuck with Infogrames' Micro Machines... though the latter's succesor, the DS, did get the handheld version of V4.

Micro Machines (C) Hasbro
